entries.title: Sen. Alex Padilla (D., Calif.) was forcibly ejected from a press conference Thursday where federal immigration officials said they would forge ahead with their operations in Los Angeles.
Republicans’ tax-and-spending megabill would give more money to middle-income and high-income households while taking benefits away from low-income people, according to a new CBO analysis
House Republicans narrowly passed a White House-proposed rescissions package that targets previously appropriated funding for NPR, PBS and foreign aid
“Political elite warmongers” have brought the world closer to the “the brink of nuclear annihilation than ever before,” Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard says in social-media video post
The Senate confirmed a vocal Trump supporter, former Republican Rep. Billy Long, to run the IRS, as Democrats criticized the pick as unqualified
Christy Walton, a billionaire Walmart heiress, is publicly speaking out against President Trump, breaking with the rest of the wealthy family and risking backlash for their retail empire
David Hogg—whose plan to unseat sitting lawmakers had caused Democrats heartburn—won’t run again for his post with the Democratic National Committee

The entire board of the Fulbright program, the nation’s flagship academic exchange program, resigned over what they called unprecedented and impermissible political interference from the Trump administration
The EPA is proposing to drop climate standards on power plants, as well as weaken regulations on mercury from coal burning. Critics say the moves will hurt public health.
Many of President Trump’s Republican allies have decided to skip Saturday’s military parade. Some GOP lawmakers are fretting openly about the cost.
A moment of both opportunity and political peril is playing out for California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Molly Ball writes
The other nasty breakup inside MAGA: Two former friends are accusing each other of grift and betrayal.
President Trump’s first-term pentagon chief said active-duty military should rarely be deployed to quell protests. Today, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, appears to have no such qualms.
David Hogg has a plan to revitalize the moribund Democratic brand: get rid of some of the party’s oldest lawmakers. More than a few party leaders aren’t pleased.
President Trump and Elon Musk praised each other at a farewell news conference as the billionaire returns to the private sector though Trump said Musk would continue advising him
President Trump is at risk of shrinking the Republican coalition that he broadened to win the 2024 election
The U.S. is moving to draw down its presence in the Middle East to essential personnel, the State Department and Pentagon said, as tensions in the region rise
Several U.S. government agencies in 2022 and 2023 tracked foreign nationals coming and going to Elon Musk’s properties, according to people familiar with the matter
UFO myths gripped America for decades, and the Pentagon finally figured out where a lot of them came from. It was the Pentagon.

An inspector general probe into Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s use of the Signal messaging service is focusing on whether details of a military operation were classified and if anyone ordered texts to be deleted
President Trump issued executive orders that ease restrictions on American drones and give local law enforcement more power to take down rogue drones
